I have avoided this Yoga for so long because of its name, sounded too girly for me and as I'm still not very good at embracing my feminity, I kept avoiding it for couple of years now.  But today a cloudy silent Sunday morning, I woke up early and decided to go beyond the name and give it a go. The practice was amazing but man oh man right after I finished I went down to read the comments and I don't know what happened but a heavy emotion washed over me and I started sobing like a baby. Now, one year before today I would of freaked out but today I just welcomed the cry and the whole emotion. I got my box of tissues and a blanket and wrapped myself like a burrito of love <del>as Adrienne says in one of my favorite practices of her</del> and lied down in my yoga mat wrapped in my blanket and just cried. I have been building myself up this year after leaving a toxic relationship, and I dedicated this practice for me. I also have been harboring so much stress lately and I have been feeling it in my upper back and my throat the past week. I knew it but I didn't know how to release it but I think this was what I needed today. Thank you is not enough Adrienne, I have been doing yoga with you since 2015 on and off and the past year no day has passed without me getting on the mat with you before starting my day, even if it's for 5 minutes. Once my friend asked me why I do yoga, I told her, I like the work out and the flexibility but tbh I do it for my sanity and to recenter myself. I'm now in the point where I can't imagine my life without yoga and without these practices with you. Your gentleness and guidance is priceless thank you for your hard work for yoga, for your gentleness and light spirit, for being the best , for providing us all such amazing practices for free, and for bringing us all together from all around the world♥️♥️ And if you ever struggle with purpose please know that you have changed my life for the best. Much love ♥️

I listen with my heart and accept my mind in its chaos. I move with love on the mat and it transfers to love in live too. Ive struggled with anger and depression all of my life, wrestling questions about right and wrong, and I've lost myself to addiction -- to people, to drugs, to school -- but now im addicted to life. Im addicted to love. And it is my greatest wish to help others reach this same conclusion. Adriene, you had a wonderful mother. Im sure she wasn't perfect, but she was perfect for you.
